intro: Hepetis fendleri, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. The genus Hepetis is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
